p: A few years later, Diphtheria and Tetanus were discovered to be caused by bacterial toxins. With the collaboration of Gaston Ramon, in 1920, Behring described an efficacious vaccine against both diphtheria and tetanus, composed of the inactivated toxins, with alumina to improve efficacy ( 16). Furthermore, Albert Calmette and Camille Guerin attenuated Mycobacterium bovis and obtained the attenuated BCG vaccine against tuberculosis in 1924 ( 17). A vaccine composed by the toxoids of Diphtheria and Tetanus and inactivated Bordetella pertussis was only launched in the USA in 1948, but because of safety issues, a double vaccine against only Diphtheria and Tetanus continued to be used and a new acellular pertussis vaccine was only licensed in the USA in 1996 ( 18).
